linux.desc: Show size of directory in MB (Change M to G for GB)
Show statistics about a drive (remove path for all)
Display memory usage in human-readable units
Show amount of files in directory and its sub-directories
Print all rows together with the filenames and rows a string is found in
Show open ports on current host (linux)

linux.command: echo Hostname: $(hostname); echo Local_IP: $(hostname -i | awk '{print $1}'); echo Default_Gateway: $(ip route | awk '/default/ {print $3}')
linux.desc: Print IP Address, Hostname, Default Route
Create a quick compressed backup of a directory
Search for a specific file in folder (recursive, case-insensitive (use -name for case sensitive))
Zip a folder and all of its contents into a archive
Create a symbolic link pointing to a file on the system

python.desc: Serve the current directory over HTTP on port 8000
Upgrade pip to the latest version
Export current Python dependencies to requirements.txt

python.command: pip install jupyterlab ipykernel && python3 -m ipykernel install --user --name=project-name
python.desc: Install and initialise the kernel to use in jupyter

go.desc: Initialise a go project and create a mod file
Run all benchmarks in the module

go.command: GOOS=linux GOARCH=amd64 go build -o bin/myprogram.exe main.go
go.desc: Cross-compile for Linux (alt. windows, darwin (arm64 / amd64))

git.desc: Create and checkout a new branch
Rebase commits from source branch to target branch
Merge commits from another branch into the one command is run on
Stash changes without commiting (add stash@{n} for specific stash from 'git stash list'
See what is changed right now
Change origin url (example from https to ssh)

gpg.desc: Encrypts message.txt with the recipients key into message.txt.gpg
Decrypt a file with a encrypted message
Export a existing (public) key into a file
Send a signed key to a keyserver

security.desc: Run a command in a sandbox with no access to the home dir or the network
Scan a IP Address for open ports and os information
Scan a specific port to see more information about service running
Scan a ssh port for all ssh relavant info
System checking tools for malware and auditing on linux
Audit installed packages for known vulnerabilities (pacman)

package managers.command: pacman -Syu / yay -Syu / dnf update / apt update && apt upgrade

other installs.desc: Unite multiple pdf files into one
Decrypt (or encrypt with --encrypt) a pdf file
